title: A Good Way of Handling Blurred Photos
answer:
**A Good Way of Handling Blurred Photos**

Taking photos in a dark environment will make the photos blurred. 

The camera fails to focus if you press the shutter button directly. ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150525143328247001.jpg)

If you try to focus the camera, the photo gets clear for a second and then becomes blurred. Even if you manage to press the shutter button at or before the second when the photo is clear, the camera needs time to respond. Therefore, the photo will still be blurred. ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150525143329476002.jpg)

In this case, you can make use of another object. For example, stick a foot or finger in the viewfinder. When the camera captures the foot or finger, press the shutter button. The photo will be clear. ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150525143329516003.jpg)
